intro: Convolvulus tricolor subsp. meonanthus, commonly known as the meadow bluebell, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the bindweed family (Convolvulaceae) and is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, bell-shaped flowers. The flowers are typically blue or purple, with three petals, and bloom in early spring. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland edges and meadows.
